provenance: [Rodman Gallery, New York, sold to Hillstrom, 1946, for $10]; Rev. Richard Lewis Hillstrom, Edina, MInn. (until 2012; given to MIA).
text: Abraham Sacrificing Isaac is finely drawn in graphite and appears to be a preparatory drawing for an 18th-century German book illustration. Below the image is a partly illegible four-line inscription. The sweet-faced angel gently restrains the distraught father and points heavenward. Throughout the drawing, one observes firm but delicate outlines and finely modulated shading that beautifully captures the softly raking early-morning light. The ram is seen caught in the brambles to the left, and a mountainous landscape extends into the distance.
title: Abraham Sacrificing Isaac
